channel.title: RAT's and their day to day usefulness
channel.description:
First off, If you do not know what a RAT is it is a remote administrative tool. I did not see any rules about "hack"/"virus" discussion so I did not see any reason not to post this.
On to the topic. Recently just finishing my Freshmen Year of college, about a month before finals I managed to get a RAT disguised as a hitter file from a C++ program onto my Professors computer. Blah Blah Blah, to the point, It gave me full access to his computer when i knew he was out of the room. Gave me access to the final and turned out pretty excellent. Anyone else with fun success stories?
Also in an early defense, One don't call me a script kiddie right off the back. And two Yes I do know what I am doing. :-D
EDIT: If a staff believes this would be better suited in programming general or else where, please move it.

item.title: RAT's and their day to day usefulness

[quote=“Mopman, post:26, topic:340415”]pff, we werent alive in the good old days[/quote]jhbflkvbsdkbnrfg you just made me rage.

Read full topic

item.title: RAT's and their day to day usefulness
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

Whatever happened to the good old days where people used to learn how to do this shit without using skid programs to assist them? Now all I see is faggy virus-generators (p0kes, etc . . .), RAT’s and BotNet programs.

Read full topic
item.source: RAT's and their day to day usefulness

item.title: RAT's and their day to day usefulness
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“xxxxxx 13, post:23, topic:340415”]You are calling me a skiddie? Alright then. When you develop your own RAT with enough options to get done what you need to get done let me know. I would love to see it. I don’t have the knowledge on how to create or even alter a program that creates sessions such as a RAT. Ironically not alot of people who use MITB do. That is like calling someone a skiddie for using an antivirus program. They didn’t make it. But yet they use it as a tool to get what they want to get done. shrugs Sorry if this would be considered a bump. Its still the most recent topic and its only three days. In addition I am the OP.[/quote]Well no, not really. A skiddie uses other peoples programs to hack, not to protect themselves against viruses. You’d still be a tool if you posted a topic about how you had a raging battle with a virus, using norton as your only weapon.

Read full topic
item.source: RAT's and their day to day usefulness

[/quote]Yeah, meant to type "learning to program in scar, was doing other shit then.[/quote]Like learning SRL/SCAR?

item.title: RAT's and their day to day usefulness
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

xx matty xx:

my old school used to store unencrypted account credentials in plaintext on the hd of every client machine for some reason, probably some sort of shitty caching technique. couldn’t think of anything fun to do tho…

similar thing here, there was a specific directory of user credentials such as passwords and information but I didnt know what to do with it

this was in grade 6 btw

Read full topic

lolscammed[/quote]
thats just a faggot thing to do…

item.title: RAT's and their day to day usefulness
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Similar story, for one of a gcse ict paper I got a printed version of it a day before the exam. We all knew my teachers password because she’s dumb and left it as the default. My friend logged in and found the paper the day before and transferred it to his memory stick.

Funny thing was about half an hour after he’d put it on his memory stick he some how managed to lose the memory stick, we knew it was in one of the bins so we had to beg the school cleaners to let us go through the bags of rubbish, luckily we found it at the bottom of a stinky bin bag. We worked for that god damn paper.

Read full topic
